author: Isreal Mathew
comment: I really do enjoy this watch face. Whilst it is a current limitation with the Watchmaker platform, it'd be nice if I didn't have to keep setting it back to 12 hour mode after each watch restart or face change. I've left feedback to that effect on the Watchmaker Premium app. Looking forward to more from this dev.

reply.author: VizorWatch
reply.content: Hello! Unfortunately, at the moment there are no technical capability to reliably memorize user's settings. This is a technical limitation of the program WatchMaker. As far as I know, the developers WatchMaker think about implementing this capability, but it is unknown when this will work.

title: Great watch face... Watchmaker needs to support remembering user settings

author: Miguel Francisco Ruiz
comment: I can give 5 stars if you can change the compass by the weather wind direction and move it to extend weather screen. For those with a Moto 360, like me, compass is useless because our device does not have one. You could release the result  like update and you will get 5 *****. I can also pay for a specific Moto 360 version with that change. No need to refund the current one. Hope you can make it. Thanks.
title: I can give 5 if...

author: Aaron Powell
comment: I love the watch face. I would like to disable the added touch spots for the compass since it seems to get pushed a lot. Also, in 12h mode, the 12 shows as 0 not 12. Please fix.
title: Good watch, some annoyances

author: Innov8or
comment: the best watch face I've found so far. Suits my LG Urbane perfectly. icons are easily distinguishable which makes it easier to read the watch with a quick glimpse. Compass is perfect and very useful for me. I have a few suggestions. It'd be great if you can implement them. I am ready to donate a modest amount and 5 stars :) It's very smart to have different sections for different categories such as weather, fitness and calendar. Can you integrate the following: Missed calls and unread messages in the calendar section with tiny interactive icons next to the calendar section to alert the user. Wind speed and direction etc in the weather section One of the most important features for fisherman like me is tide times and swell data, can this be integrated? Nobody has got this. You can be the first! You can have another section such as "outdoor" and this would have moon data including moon down and up, sunrise and sunset, tide times and heights, swell data (tide times and swell is very important for surfers and sailors as well). Compass can be moved here too. Then the fitness would have constant/on demand heart rate monitoring, stop watch, steps etc You can do it!!! Please!!! :)

reply.author: VizorWatch
reply.content: Hello! Unfortunately the program WatchMaker has technical limitations. As far as I know, currently there's no way to output information about missed calls and so on. In addition, a large amount of output data can greatly reduce the stability and greatly increase the battery drain. But it's an interesting thought. I'll see what I can do.

author: Steven Dino Windfeld
comment: I rarely give reviews, but this watchface is far beyond any other. I have spent hours upon hours on the play store, forums and so on, but no other watch even comes close to this masterpiece. I do have a tiny wish/request - I would love the watchface to display the current week number (perhaps implemented as a user choice in the watchface settings)
title: Simply amazing

author: Kishor Krishnan
comment: Only flaw I have problems with is the event at the bottom. The moto 360 only brings up the app drawer when u swipe either the top or bottom so if u swipe the middle almost all the time it will seem like the watch is lagging. In this watchface only the top part works because the bottom keeps opening the event tab. Other than that I love this watch face. Especially the weather tab. Beautiful animations all around.....UPDATE, ok now I have a problem...a big one. I change the time from 24 to12 and it won't stay

reply.author: VizorWatch
reply.content: Hello, Kishore. Unfortunately, there is no technical ability to remember user settings. This limitation of the program WatchMaker. The developers promise to implement this feature in the future. On this during some of the failures of the settings will be reset to their default values.

title: Almost perfect

author: Nabeel Meamary
comment: The watch face is very nice and functions useful.  I will give a 5 star if it wasn't for the time lag it experience during the dim mode. Showing 1 to 2 minutes behind

reply.author: VizorWatch
reply.content: Hello. The screen refresh rate in economy mode does not depend on the set watch face. This feature depends entirely on the program WatchMaker. In addition, the refresh rate of the screen directly affects the power consumption. If in economy mode the screen is updated more frequently, the power consumption would be considerably higher.

title: Overall good app

author: Asim Naveed
comment: Purchased it but not showing in LG urbane.

reply.author: VizorWatch
reply.content: Hello! Did you read the description for this dial? Drew you attention to the fact that this is the dial for the program WatchMaker? In the description to this dial has detailed instructions.

title: Not working with Urbane

author: Shaun McMillan
comment: Really slick, wore this on my wear for over a week, it's awesome, slick animations, doesn't drain battery too much, but I play with it all the time. Great job everyone.

author: Daniel Greenwood
comment: Absolutely love this face. Looks brilliant on my LG Urbane. Also extremely functional and we'll laid out. Thank You!!
title: Brilliant

author: Fred Schmitthammer
comment: I like this face. I am a big fan of digital.  This is an awesome face! Thank you for the hard work and awesome design.

reply.author: VizorWatch
reply.content: Hello. Unfortunately, the program WatchMaKer can output a variable start time and the end of calendar events only in 24 hours format. It is a technical limitation. I still figure out how to work around this limitation.

title: Nice Work

author: vampzim
comment: Just ordered a full android watch, might not wear it now that I have this watch face. :P
title: Love it

author: Scott Gibbons
comment: best watch face I have found, everything I want to see clearly legible.

author: Richard Lawson
comment: One of the best watch faces out there. Thanks for the hard work in creating it.
title: Excellent

author: John Thompson
comment: Great work on this watch face.  I'm looking forward to see how you might improve on it.
title: Great watch face.

author: Gabe Ochoa
comment: Love this watch face, has almost everything I need!!
title: Amazing

author: Gary Dale
comment: It s works great thanks

reply.author: VizorWatch
reply.content: Hello. Sorry, but I don't understand what you mean. Could you outline your idea in more details?

author: Tianyu Guo
comment: Best watchface so far

author: Alan Jones
comment: nice

author: Sam Giordano
comment: Works as described.  Only wish there was a few minor enhancement. Such as the calendar showing events coming up and not always show the beginning of my day even at 9 in the evening.  Overall would recommend.

reply.author: VizorWatch
reply.content: Hello! Unfortunately, I don't understand English very well and didn't quite get your point. Perhaps it can help you: change some of the settings in the program WatchMaker under "Calendar". There's an option to enable the display of events in the coming days, not just today.

title: Good watch face, very functional.

author: Eric Crossley
comment: Love this face! looks great and had everything I was looking for in a watch face, until it broke. Temperature gauge has read 48F and the same 5 day forecast has shown for 2 weeks now. Tried restarting phone and watch, updating everything, and reinstalling, but nothing works. Not sure if this is a bug caused by the new year, but im going to have to switch faces if I cant get it to update, which is a shame. I really loved this face.
title: Great watch face, until it broke
